channel.title: Perfect Dragonfire shield [No .mqo discolouring]
channel.description:
Before you say - or even [i]think[/i] "lul nub everyone has dis", please read the whole thing.
Now, some of you are probably aware that if you take the Dragonfire shield (wield) model from the RuneScape cache, it's animation data doesn't seem to be correct! To get around this, it was converted into an .mqo and remade into a .dat with the correct animation data. However, converteing models into a .mqo causes discolouring - you might have noticed this. Even so, almost every client I have seen uses this ugly model!
So I decided to fix the issue myself since nobody else would. I took the original model and changed the animation data using a basic Hex editor, thus avoiding the conversion into an .mqo process. Since all I changed was the animation data, everything else, such as priorities and colours are still correct!
Here is the result!
[b]BEFORE:[/b] [img]http://i48.tinypic.com/zx6yhy.png[/img]
[b]AFTER:[/b] [img]http://i50.tinypic.com/331d56u.png[/img]
Model link is attatched, I hope you like it. Please post your thoughts on this ;)

item.title: Perfect Dragonfire shield [No .mqo discolouring]
item.dc:creator: @BoneArmyProductions BoneArmyProductions
item.description:
@BoneArmyProductions wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:23, topic:328615”][quote author=BoneArmyProductions link=topic=425014.msg3128095#msg3128095 date=1266192502]

HOW COOL! You leeched of a client!
OMG THATS SO AWESOME! (Sarcasm)

well sorry to say but every one has it.
and the golden part kills it

Obviously can’t read.

i read the whole thing im not blind.
i noticed the colors
who doesnt have this

You’re stupid as fuck. This one was hex edited the animation in so that the colors weren’t changed from the original 474 colors like they are on all clients that have the animation done through .mqo -> .dat transition.

your stupid as fuck who needs that when it was done another way?
[/quote]
People who want the model to look good?[/quote]
It was done before an easier way…
and that? is calling models looking good?
did you not notice the colour that is not supposed to be there?

Read full topic
